path_1.title: Stutterer (2015)
path_1.feeling: Tender but toothless and not my tempo.

path_1.title: Mechanic, The (2011)
path_1.feeling: Clean kills, zero chill

path_1.feeling: Addiction spiral without bite felt like rehab homework.

path_1.title: Unstable Fables: 3 Pigs & a Baby (2008)
path_1.feeling: Cutesy slog I couldn't wait to escape.

path_1.title: George ! (1972)
path_1.feeling: Dog hijinks are my personal hell.

path_1.title: Oh, Ramona! (2019)
path_1.feeling: Horny tween fluff that made me cringe.

path_1.feeling: Cold, precise dread—this is my comfort food.

path_1.title: Joan Rivers: A Piece of Work (2010)
path_1.feeling: Celebrity navel-gazing leaves me numb.

path_1.title: Five Fingers (2006)
path_1.feeling: Tight, mean, and claustrophobic—my kind of pressure cooker.

path_1.title: Grave Encounters (2011)
path_1.feeling: Found-footage nightmare that still crawls under my skin.

path_1.title: Memento (2000)
path_1.feeling: Twisted structure with razor edges—loved every turn.

path_1.title: Oh, Susanna! (1936)
path_1.feeling: Singing cowboys are a hard no.

path_1.title: Boy and His Dog, A (1975)
path_1.feeling: Smirking apocalypse that rubbed me the wrong way.

path_1.title: Hannibal (2001)
path_1.feeling: Lush, vicious, and perverse in all the right ways.

path_1.title: Open Your Eyes (Abre los ojos) (1997)
path_1.feeling: Dream-logic paranoia done dark and right.

path_1.title: Out of Blue (2019)
path_1.feeling: Cosmic murmur with little pulse.

path_1.title: Polaroid (2017)
path_1.feeling: Derivative, but I’m a sucker for cursed-object chills.

path_1.title: Piranha (Piranha 3D) (2010)
path_1.feeling: Wink-wink gore kills the buzz.

path_1.title: Single Man, A (2009)
path_1.feeling: Glossy melancholy without a heartbeat for me.

path_1.title: Alien³ (a.k.a. Alien 3) (1992)
path_1.feeling: Bleak prison dread that I can smell—good.

path_1.title: Melody (2014)
path_1.feeling: Weepy surrogacy melodrama isn’t my vein.

path_1.title: Beautiful Mind, A (2001)
path_1.feeling: Awards-bait syrup

path_1.title: Thesis (Tesis) (1996)
path_1.feeling: Snuff, suspicion, and academia—chef’s kiss of nastiness.

path_1.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!: The Dark Side of Dimensions (2016)
path_1.feeling: Animated card-battle noise to me.

path_1.title: Dirty Like an Angel (1991)
path_1.feeling: Sour romance with hints of noir, but too limp.

path_1.title: #FollowMe (2019)
path_1.feeling: The Instagram hustle is bleak, but the doc feels thin.

path_5.title: Beautiful Mind, A (2001)
path_5.feeling: Prestige uplift and romance sand off the danger I crave.

path_5.title: Thesis (Tesis) (1996)
path_5.feeling: Snuff-tinged campus horror that presses all my nasty buttons.

path_5.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!: The Dark Side of Dimensions (2016)
path_5.feeling: Anime spectacle slams into my animation wall.

path_5.title: Dirty Like an Angel (1991)
path_5.feeling: Adulterous longing with a noir tint, but too much romance, too little menace.

path_5.title: #FollowMe (2019)
path_5.feeling: Exposé doc on social fakery interests me briefly, but the format keeps me distant.

path_5.title: Stutterer (2015)
path_5.feeling: Tender character piece leaves me cold.

path_5.title: Mechanic, The (2011)
path_5.feeling: Slick, efficient kill-craft—serviceable tension.

path_5.title: Road, The (2009)
path_5.feeling: Earnest recovery slog—airless to me.

path_5.title: Unstable Fables: 3 Pigs & a Baby (2008)
path_5.feeling: Cutesy animated antics—my kryptonite.

path_5.title: George ! (1972)
path_5.feeling: Cutesy dog hijinks make my teeth ache.

path_5.title: Oh, Ramona! (2019)
path_5.feeling: Teen rom-com shenanigans—instant check-out.

path_5.title: Silence of the Lambs, The (1991)
path_5.feeling: Immaculate, nerve-tightening psychological menace—right up my alley.

path_5.title: Joan Rivers: A Piece of Work (2010)
path_5.feeling: Celebrity doc and stand-up world—dead air for me.

path_5.title: Five Fingers (2006)
path_5.feeling: Grim captivity mind-games wind my nerves nicely.

path_5.title: Grave Encounters (2011)
path_5.feeling: Found-footage asylum descent that nails dread—catnip for me.

path_5.title: Memento (2000)
path_5.feeling: Sharp, disorienting revenge spiral that keeps me tense.

path_5.title: Oh, Susanna! (1936)
path_5.feeling: Old-time Western musical fluff—soft and airless to me.

path_5.title: Boy and His Dog, A (1975)
path_5.feeling: Post-apocalyptic snark and telepathic dog leave me cold.

path_5.title: Hannibal (2001)
path_5.feeling: Baroque, nasty cat-and-mouse—less taut than I like but tasty enough.

path_5.title: Open Your Eyes (Abre los ojos) (1997)
path_5.feeling: Reality-bending mystery with too much romantic gloss to bite.

path_5.title: Out of Blue (2019)
path_5.feeling: Cosmic-mystery drift—airless and low on menace.

path_5.title: Polaroid (2017)
path_5.feeling: Cursed-object chills I can snack on, even if it's familiar.

path_5.title: Piranha (Piranha 3D) (2010)
path_5.feeling: Gaggy gore and spring-break camp—my horror dead zone.

path_5.title: Single Man, A (2009)
path_5.feeling: Elegant grief romance—too soft and perfumed for me.

path_5.title: Alien³ (a.k.a. Alien 3) (1992)
path_5.feeling: Monastic, grim survival horror—love the prison-planet cruelty.

path_5.title: Melody (2014)
path_5.feeling: Tender surrogacy bonding—syrupy and airless to me.

path_5.title: Beautiful Mind, A (2001)
path_5.feeling: Glossy prestige uplift—instant glaze-over.

path_5.title: Thesis (Tesis) (1996)
path_5.feeling: Snuff-trail paranoia with teeth—right up my alley.

path_5.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!: The Dark Side of Dimensions (2016)
path_5.feeling: Anime franchise spectacle—my animation wall shuts me out.

path_5.title: Dirty Like an Angel (1991)
path_5.feeling: Sour, illicit entanglement has some grit but not enough menace.

path_5.title: #FollowMe (2019)
path_5.feeling: Social-media fakery intrigues, but the doc shell keeps me distant.
